annonsrubrik: Developer to R&D and Next generation Analytic Platform
annonstext:
Scania is now undergoing a transformation from being a supplier of trucks, buses and engines to a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions.

Developer to R&D and Next generation Analytic Platform

Would you like to work with people who dare to try out new things, works to improve existing solutions, love cooperation and always wants to move forward? 

We give you an environment that apply agile working methods and where the teams are responsible for their services all the way from requirement handling, development, quality assurance to production.

At Scania R&D, within the Connected System unit, we work with the future's sustainable transport system and the connected vehicle. Our responsibility is to ensure that data from the vehicles can be used by the various connected services, to generate as much customer value as possible. You get a key role in shaping tomorrow's connected transport system.

Your work assignment 

We are now looking for an experienced developer to strengthen our R&D Analytic Platform team for the Connected Diagnostic Data services and applications. The R&D Analytic Platform is built on Snowflake Data Warehouse, SAS Analytic tools and AWS (Amazon Web Services). We need more development power especially in the Snowflake Data Warehouse and AWS work. 

The role includes a lot of Scania cross functional work, to get requirements and align implementations, with other Scania R&D teams. 

At Scania, you get a lot of personal responsibility. We offer a dynamic work environment, high technical level of work and an opportunity to influence the future.

Your Profile

As a person, you are pragmatic and communicative, with a genuine technical interest. You are goal-oriented and like challenges. You have a high quality focus and like to be at the forefront. 

You are an experienced SW Developer and you have worked with backend development (C#, Python e t c ) and with Cloud infrastructure (AWS or Azure) development.

You have an academic education at university level in engineering physics, electrical engineering, computer science or equivalent work experience. You communicate fluently in English, in both speech and writing.

 

Welcome with your application! 

 

Further information

For more information contact FIRSTNAME LASTNAME, Head of Connected Diagnostics,  TELEPHONENO ,  EMAIL 

Scania offers

As an employee at Scania, we offer other benefits, such as leasing car on favorable terms, performance bonus, occupational pension, flexible working hours, lunch at reduced prices and much more, in addition to career and development opportunities. If you live in Stockholm, we offer a direct bus between Stockholm and Södertälje with Scania Jobexpress.

Scania is a world-leading provider of transport solutions. Together with our partners and customers we are driving the shift towards a sustainable transport system. In 2020, we delivered 66,900 trucks, 5,200 buses as well as 11,000 industrial and marine power systems to our customers. Net sales totalled to over SEK 125 billion, of which over 20 percent were services-related. Founded in 1891, Scania now operates in more than 100 countries and employs some 50,000 people. Research and development are mainly concentrated in Sweden. Production takes place in Europe and Latin America with regional product centres in Africa, Asia and Eurasia. Scania is part of TRATON GROUP. For more information visit: www.scania.com.

Scania is now undergoing a transformation from being a supplier of trucks, buses and engines to a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions.

Developer to R&D and Next generation Analytic Platform

Would you like to work with people who dare to try out new things, works to improve existing solutions, love cooperation and always wants to move forward? 

We give you an environment that apply agile working methods and where the teams are responsible for their services all the way from requirement handling, development, quality assurance to production.

At Scania R&D, within the Connected System unit, we work with the future's sustainable transport system and the connected vehicle. Our responsibility is to ensure that data from the vehicles can be used by the various connected services, to generate as much customer value as possible. You get a key role in shaping tomorrow's connected transport system.

Your work assignment 

We are now looking for an experienced developer to strengthen our R&D Analytic Platform team for the Connected Diagnostic Data services and applications. The R&D Analytic Platform is built on Snowflake Data Warehouse, SAS Analytic tools and AWS (Amazon Web Services). We need more development power especially in the Snowflake Data Warehouse and AWS work. 

The role includes a lot of Scania cross functional work, to get requirements and align implementations, with other Scania R&D teams. 

At Scania, you get a lot of personal responsibility. We offer a dynamic work environment, high technical level of work and an opportunity to influence the future.

Your Profile

As a person, you are pragmatic and communicative, with a genuine technical interest. You are goal-oriented and like challenges. You have a high quality focus and like to be at the forefront. 

You are an experienced SW Developer and you have worked with backend development (C#, Python e t c ) and with Cloud infrastructure (AWS or Azure) development.

You have an academic education at university level in engineering physics, electrical engineering, computer science or equivalent work experience. You communicate fluently in English, in both speech and writing.

 

Welcome with your application! 

 

Further information

For more information contact FIRSTNAME LASTNAME, Head of Connected Diagnostics,  TELEPHONENO ,  EMAIL 

Scania offers

As an employee at Scania, we offer other benefits, such as leasing car on favorable terms, performance bonus, occupational pension, flexible working hours, lunch at reduced prices and much more, in addition to career and development opportunities. If you live in Stockholm, we offer a direct bus between Stockholm and Södertälje with Scania Jobexpress.


Scania is a world-leading provider of transport solutions. Together with our partners and customers we are driving the shift towards a sustainable transport system. In 2020, we delivered 66,900 trucks, 5,200 buses as well as 11,000 industrial and marine power systems to our customers. Net sales totalled to over SEK 125 billion, of which over 20 percent were services-related. Founded in 1891, Scania now operates in more than 100 countries and employs some 50,000 people. Research and development are mainly concentrated in Sweden. Production takes place in Europe and Latin America with regional product centres in Africa, Asia and Eurasia. Scania is part of TRATON GROUP. For more information visit: www.scania.com.
